description: Borrowed from Latin palpātus, perfect passive participle of palpō (“touch softly”).

verbs.description: palpate (third-person singular simple present palpates, present participle palpating, simple past and past participle palpated)

entries.meaning: To examine or otherwise explore through touch, particularly (medicine) in reference to an area or organ of the human body.
examples: David reached inside with his fingers and palpated a logic board.
